intro: Thomsonaria corymbifera, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and containers. Thomsonaria corymbifera is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
